text: In this section, we walk through how each complaint is investigated and resolved in a structured,
transparent way. Once a complaint is reflected in the I/O portal, it appears under unprocessed.
The Investigation Officer reviews the details and activates the case by marking it in process.
This step starts the formal investigation and triggers system-based timeline tracking.
The Investigation Officer then conducts a validity assessment, checking whether the complaint
is valid, partially valid, or invalid.
This assessment is based on evidence, worker interviews, and cross-checking internal records.
The Investigation Officer documents this reasoning clearly in the root cause analysis section.
Once validity of complaint is checked, the Investigation Officer develops a detailed corrective
and preventive action plan.
This includes the immediate corrective actions needed and the preventive measures to stop
the issue from happening again.
Responsibilities are assigned, timelines are set, and the plan is entered into the system
so nothing is missed.
After implementing the actions, the Investigation Officer uploads all evidence, photos, statements,
voice notes, or policies.
Once all requirements are met, the Investigation Officer submits the case to FOS for closure
review.
FOS Team contacts back the complainant directly for verification.
We explain the actions taken and confirm if the worker is satisfied with the outcome.
This independent check ensures fairness and builds trust.
If the worker is not satisfied, the case is bounced back to the investigation officer
for rework, the investigation officer must update the RCA, revise the CAPA, and resubmit with improved documentation.
This prevents premature or incomplete closures.
When the worker confirms satisfaction, FOS officially closes the complaint and records closure feedback.
These insights help factories understand recurring issues and strengthen long-term risk prevention.
